definition: to rest/to stop doing sth for a period of time/to cease/(imperative) don't

sentences.english: This marks another phase of a truce in a protracted diplomatic war.
sentences.chinese: 这标志着这一长期的外交战将进入休战阶段。

sentences.english: A joint communique of truce was issued on June 5 that year.
sentences.chinese: 一份休战的联合公报在那年6月5日发表。

sentences.english: Three years later, Romania was overrun by the Soviets and signed an armistice.
sentences.chinese: 三年后，罗马尼亚被前苏联入侵，并签署了休战协议。

sentences.english: One of the warring families wanted to make peace and arrange a parley.
sentences.chinese: 交战的家族之一想休战讲和并安排一次谈判。

sentences.english: For now, IKEA and the lonely hearts are in an uneasy truce.
sentences.chinese: 现在，宜家公司与孤身人们仍然处于紧张的休战阶段。

sentences.english: A truce has been patched up.
sentences.chinese: 休战条约已草草订就了。

sentences.english: Some countries observe November 11th as Armistice Day or RemembranceDay.
sentences.chinese: 一些国家把这一天定为休战日或荣军纪念日。

sentences.english: Afterward the Sparta king and the Elis king has signed " the sacred armistice month " the treaty.
sentences.chinese: 后来斯巴达王和伊利斯王签订了“神圣休战月”条约。

sentences.english: So they decide to call a truce, and the two go their separate ways.
sentences.chinese: 所以他们决定休战，各自上路，相忘于江湖。

sentences.english: Hetman Kalinowski, with complete victory within his grasp, agreed to a truce.
sentences.chinese: 盖特曼卡琳瑙斯基带着他掌握的全面胜利，同意休战。

sentences.english: Some countries observe November 11th as Armistice Day or Remembrance Day.
sentences.chinese: 一些国家把这一天视为休战纪念日或荣军纪念日。

sentences.english: Officers from each side met at the truce village of Panmunjom.
sentences.chinese: 各方官员在板门店休战村会见。

definition: to come back out of retirement/to get involved again after having withdrawn
on stage/to go on stage/to take the field
to heal a wound/to recuperate (from an injury)
consecutive defeats/to lose several times in a row
horseman/cavalryman/knight (i.e. European nobility)/(Tw) bike rider (scooter, bicycle etc)
poised for battle/to square up for a fight
to replace (a damaged component with a new one, an injured player with a substitute player, full-time workers with casual workers etc)/a substitute/a replacement
